userreviews.userReview: A good explanation of cyberculture and cybernetics with an emphasis on Haraway and Castells. I was suprised by the absence of the Macy Conferences.

This is a good book for seeing the range of study that cyberculture theory covers. There are some interesting theories that Bell touches on, but he also doesn't full explain some concepts that are necessary for understanding theories, and he approaches the book as though everyone should already know something about cyberculture. However, since it is a beginners' book, that's a pretty big failing in my eyes. There's a lot of interesting information, however, and if you are willing to look up some of the terminology and such, then you'll be okay.
I believe I just found the Cliff's Notes series for PhD students.
a very fast survey. made me want to read some castells so I guess it worked

description: Cyberculture Theorists is the ideal starting point for anyone wanting to understand how to theorise cyberculture in all its forms. It surveys a 'cluster' of works that explore the cultures of cyberspace, the Internet and the information society.
title:
Cyberculture Theorists: Manuel Castells and Donna Haraway
      
          (Routledge Critical Thinkers)
